Html:
After downloading the latest zip file, unzipping to a local drive and attempting to open with Visual Studio 2005, I got a message that " the project location is not trusted..." . This is due to the fact that the zip was built on a different server than the one that I extracted to. The solution is found at the BOTTOM of this article: http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bs2bkwxc(VS.80).aspx

In summary, delete all of the extracted files, right click on the zip and click properties, click on the Unblock button and say OK. Reextract and you're all set
No, you have extracted this zip file on a network share. Everytime you start a solution form a networkshare, visual studio will bring this message up.
